refnamediv.refpurpose: Finds an equilibrium state of a general dynamical system described by a xcos diagram

listitem.para: scs_m : a xcos data structure containing input and output ports at the top level
cpr : a data strucure generated by the xcos_compile function.
X: column vector. Continuous state. Can be set to [] if zero.
U: column vector. Input. Can be set to [] if zero.
Y: column vector. Output. Can be set to [] if zero.
Indx : index of entries of X that are not fixed. If all can vary, set to 1:$
Indu : index of entries of U that are not fixed. If all can vary, set to 1:$
Indy : index of entries of Y that are not fixed. If all can vary, set to 1:$
Indxp : index of entries of XP (derivative of x) that need not be zero. If all can vary, set to 1:$. Default [].
param : param: list with two elements (default list(1.d-6,0))
param(1): scalar. Perturbation level for linearization; the following variation is used del([x;u])_i = param(1)+param(1)*1d-4*abs([x;u])_i.
Y: output corresponding to steady state found
XP : derivative of the state corresponding to steady state found

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function finds the steady state for a given system described by a xcos diagram or sub-diagram. The diagram should have inputs ports and outputs ports.The steady state concern only the continuous-time dynamics. The discrete time part of the diagram is frozen.

refsection.title: Examples

para.link: lincos - Constructs by linearization a linear state-space model from a general dynamical system described by a xcos diagram.
xcos_compile - Compile a diagram that contains input and output ports
